com.pasdam.regexren.gui.rules

Class ReplaceFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pasdam.regexren.gui.rules.AbstractRuleFactory
      • com.pasdam.regexren.gui.rules.ReplaceFactory

  • public class ReplaceFactory
extends AbstractRuleFactory
    AbstractRuleFactory used to create rule to replace/remove pattern from name/extension
    Version:
    0.1
    Author:
    paco

        public boolean isRegex()
        Returns true if the pattern is a regular expression, false if it is a literal pattern
        Returns:
        true if the pattern is a regular expression, false if it is a literal pattern

      • setRegex

        public void setRegex(boolean regex)
              throws java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException,
                     java.lang.NullPointerException
        Sets whether the pattern is a regular expression or a literal pattern
        Parameters:
        regex - true to indicate that the pattern is a literal expression, false to indicate a literal pattern
        Throws:
        java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException - if regex it true and the sentence separator is an invalid regular expression
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if regex is true and the sentence separator is null

        Returns:
        the end index of the replace operation

      • setEndIndex

        public void setEndIndex(int endIndex)
        Sets the end index ot the replace operation
        Parameters:
        endIndex - index (exclusive) of the character at which terminate the replace operation; a value less then or equal to startIndex or greater then text length means no limit

      • getRule

        public static Rule getRule(java.lang.String textToReplace,
                           boolean regex,
                           boolean matchCase,
                           java.lang.String textToInsert,
                           int startIndex,
                           int endIndex,
                           int target)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Factory method that create the correct rule based on the parameters
        Parameters:
        textToReplace - - text to replace with new text (textToInsert)
        regex - - if true textToReplace is parsed as a regular expression
        matchCase - - if true textToReplace is case sensitive; used only if regex is false
        textToInsert - - the new text to insert
        startIndex - - index from which start the replace operation
        endIndex - - index (exclusive) at which end the replace operation; a value less then or equal to startIndex or greater then text length means no limit
        target - - indicates the filename part to modify (name/extension) and the occurrence to replace (all/first/last); use ReplacePanel constraints to set this
        Returns:
        the right rule, based on input parameters
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if target is invalid
